name: Ulaanbaatar Hotel

reviews.text: The UB hotel was a great hotel with real character. Despite looking like an insane asylum on the outside the inside is warm and inviting. On every floor there are photos of the history of Mongolia which is a nice touch.
reviews.title: Great Old hotel!
The stars are self awarded
reviews.text: The check in was easy and efficient as the reservations manager spoke fluent English and was very helpful. Because we were traveling as a twin they were more then happy to show us the two different rooms to see which one was most suitable for us.
We stayed for 7 nights which was split over a period in June and July.
reviews.title: A fading beauty in good shape
worst "5 star" hotel on earth!!
reviews.text: The breakfast was delicious and there was a wide selection of cereals, toast, fruits, vegetables, eggs and other scrumptious things!
It has everything you would expect from a 5 star hotel in a developing country and the prices are reasonable.
reviews.title: A large concrete block

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited Mongolia for the Naadam Festival in July. The Ulaanbaatar Hotel’s location is convenient; within walking distance of various shops, several restaurants and museums. We found both of the hotel’s restaurants to be good; one was the main dining room serving lunch, dinner and a breakfast buffet, the other restaurant was Indian cuisine. Wifi was consistent within the bar/coffee shop, laundry service was efficient and the front desk was helpful with questions and money exchange. Our deluxe king room, albeit super worn, was large, comfortable and quiet. The UB Hotel has a unique history and that was the primary reason for choosing this icon. The five-star rating is indeed based upon an entirely different scale but within the standards of Mongolia we found the hotel to be a value.
reviews.title: Ulaanbaatar Hotel

reviews.text: The Hotel UB is very old, and it's showing, however, it's character shines through. You can't beat the location (center of UB), and the room we had was old time elegance. Plenty of restaurants in the hotel, as well. Room service food late at night was excellent.
reviews.title: Family travel

reviews.text: Stayed for business. Argueably the nicest hotel as a whole that I stayed in, however my specific room that stay had a problem with the "touch pad" next to the bed that controls everything in the room. Having nothing work consitently kinda runied it for me. It was clean, and room size was ok, but ultimately drove me out of the hotel as I couldnt just "relax".
reviews.title: Seriously problematic room control, but nice otherwise

reviews.text: UB is a desert with a town in the middle, similar in climate to Vegas. There is no humidity, and with the static electricity in the air, buttons would short out whenever you got your hand close, and would give a small static shock each time. Due to that (or it being faulty at any rate) the tv would only stay on 5 min at a time then pop off. Lights were the same way, off and on and off. Room was clean, service was good, close to the square and walking distance to lots of restraunts and shopping.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, centrally located

reviews.text: I didnt want to spend a lot of time in the room with that issue though. I was only there as a "day room" since I left my work site in the morning and had a midnight flight. I spent most of my day walking around. Switches in the bathroom were not wired in to the pad, so I came back after dinner, showered, changed and left for airport. Perhaps other rooms are better, or I just had a faulty unit, but the static electricity that is always present in UB is a problem with the touch pads vs switches in other hotels.
reviews.title: Nothing Stellar

reviews.text: A hotel in the center of Ulaanbaatar, providing average services.
reviews.title: Basic but not bad

reviews.text: Rooms are dated and offer nothing special. Price/quality ratio is poor but I think this is the case in most of UB hotels.
reviews.title: Great location but a basic and dated business hotel

reviews.text: I've booked a standard single room and I got a twin one. When I asked for a room with a double bed they asked for 50USD more. No thanks! :)
reviews.title: Pre and Post Expedition Stay

reviews.text: Staff is helpful and efficient. Room service was rather good. Food came quick, was warm and quality was not bad.
reviews.title: Convenient location with a nostalgic touch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to order coffee do not order form the room service but from the coffee shop (extension154 if I remember well). The coffee is much better (at a double price of course) and you can have any kind of coffee. They will bring the coffee in your room but you have to pay in cash.
reviews.title: manage your expectations

reviews.text: The claims from the literature and website for this hotel must be taken with a pinch of salt. It is obvious that about 20 years ago this was the best in town, remembering that 20 years ago this was a Soviet style economy.
reviews.title: Seen Better Days

reviews.text: The hotel tries hard but it just needs a complete overhaul. It has become a standard hotel for tour parties and those on 'adventure' trips to Mongolia. By adventure I mean the type of tourists that demand nice breakfasts, have air conditioned transport and stay in luxury ger.
reviews.title: The 5 star hotel - State Owned category !

reviews.text: Getting an early breakfast in this 'five star' emporium was impossible. I had to settle for a coffee made from instant granules served to my in a grudging and off hand manner.
reviews.title: Definitely not five-star

reviews.text: I was luckily in a suite - possibly one of the most expensive rooms in the hotel. And even this did not come with wifi. I was on business and this was important to me.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: I kind of liked the experience of being in an old fashioned, Soviet era hotel - but I am not that keen to return!
reviews.title: Great place to stay.

description: The first Five-Star Hotel in Mongolia. Built in 1961, it has been a flagship property of Mongolian Hospitality Industry. Yet the oldest but still one of the best Hotel in Mongolia. Keeping up with the developments in the industry it has now a branch hotel in Terelj national park-The UB2.
